body_html:
I think to add the cuDNN LSTM we need to modify / add the capability to the stream_executor. Is something that google is going to do or can we provide patches?
The LSTM kernel written by Nvidia seems to have quite a few optimizations.

I also have a feeling that this LSTM block is very specialized to be part of tensorflow's API.
Is there a way that a user could load this operation as a "plug-in" ?

body:
I think to add the cuDNN LSTM we need to modify / add the capability to the stream_executor. Is something that google is going to do or can we provide patches? 
[The LSTM kernel written by Nvidia seems to have quite a few optimizations](https://devblogs.nvidia.com/parallelforall/optimizing-recurrent-neural-networks-cudnn-5/).

I also have a feeling that this LSTM block is very specialized to be part of tensorflow's API. 
Is there a way that a user could load this operation as a "plug-in" ?
